greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of continued fraction 1/(1 - x/(1 - k*x/(1 - k^2*x/(1 - k^3*x/(1 - k^4*x/(1 - ...)))))).
comment: This is the transpose of the array in A090182.
formula: G.f. of column k: 1/(1 - x/(1 - k*x/(1 - k^2*x/(1 - k^3*x/(1 - k^4*x/(1 - ...)))))), a continued fraction.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(
seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 10 2017
mathematica: Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[1/(1 - x/(1 + ContinuedFractionK[-k^i x, 1, {i, 1, n}])), {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 10}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
program: def A(n, k): return 1 if n==0 else sum(A(j, k)*A(n - j - 1, k)*k**j for j in range(n))
for n in range(13): print([A(k, n - k) for k in range(n + 1)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Aug 10 2017, after Maple code
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 09 2017
